intro: Diuris arenaria, commonly known as the sand diuris, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, spurred petals. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or coastal environments. It produces small, colorful flowers that are often yellow or greenish-yellow in hue. Diuris arenaria is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes or heathlands.
